annif 0.1.1

    • Introduction to annif

    Learn from manually indexed documents

    Source: R/annif_learn.R
    annif_learn.Rd

    This function sends feedback to the Annif API to improve project models by learning from manually assigned subjects. This helps the system improve its suggestions over time based on human feedback.

    Usage

    annif_learn(project_id, documents, verbose = FALSE)

    Arguments

    project_id

    Character string representing the project identifier (e.g., "yso-en", "yso-fi").

    documents

    A list of documents with their correct subjects.

    verbose

    Logical indicating whether to print debug information (default: FALSE)

    Value

    Invisibly returns TRUE if successful, FALSE otherwise. The function primarily produces side effects (model learning) rather than returning data.

    Examples

    # \donttest{
# Create a document with correct subjects for learning
learning_doc <- list(
  text = "A quick brown fox jumped over the lazy dog.",
  subjects = list(
    list(
      uri = "http://www.yso.fi/onto/yso/p2228",
      label = "red fox"
    ),
    list(
      uri = "http://www.yso.fi/onto/yso/p5319",
      label = "dog"
    )
  ),
  metadata = list(
    source = "example",
    language = "en"
  )
)

# Send learning feedback to the model
success <- annif_learn(
  project_id = "yso-en",
  documents = list(learning_doc)
)
#> Warning: Learning failed: Operation not allowed: Learning may be disabled for this project or requires authentication

if (success) {
  cat("Learning feedback successfully submitted\n")
} else {
  cat("Failed to submit learning feedback\n")
}
#> Failed to submit learning feedback
# }
